questions.text: A 30-year-old male is brought to the hospital by his wife complaining that he has started doubting that she is trying to kill him along with his neighbors, starts shouting at times, doesn’t listen to any explanations given to him on this matter, and throws garbage and stones at the neighbor’s house. On questioning, he reports that he hears voices of people talking about him and planning to hurt him. The type of schizophrenia is
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Paranoid The paranoid type of schizophrenia is characterized by preoccupation with one or more delusions (presence of delusions of persecution or grandeur) or frequent auditory hallucinations .

Random:

Explanation For Incorrect Options:- Option B: Catatonic Type . The classic feature of the catatonic type is a marked disturbance in motor function ; this disturbance may involve stupor, negativism, rigidity, excitement, or posturing . Sometimes the patient shows a rapid alteration between extremes of excitement and stupor. Associated features include stereotypies, mannerisms, and waxy flexibility . Mutism is particularly common. Option: C. Undifferentiated Type . Frequently, patients who clearly have schizophrenia cannot easily fit into one type or another . These patients are classified as having schizophrenia of the undifferentiated type. Option: D. Residual Type . The residual type of schizophrenia is characterized by continuing evidence of the schizophrenic disturbance in the absence of a complete set of active symptoms or of sufficient symptoms to meet the diagnosis of another type of schizophrenia. Emotional blunting, social withdrawal, eccentric behavior, illogical thinking, and mild loosening of associations commonly appear in the residual type. When delusions or hallucinations occur, they are neither prominent nor accompanied by strong effect.

questions.text: During your psychiatry postings in the internship, you observe a lot of patients with schizophrenia in the ward. Given below are all negative symptoms, except:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Auditory hallucination Auditory hallucination is a positive symptom, not a negative symptom. Positive Symptoms:- Hallucinations (OPTION B) Delusions Bizarre behavior Positive formal thought disorder Negative Symptoms:- Affective flattening or blunting ( OPTION A ) Alogia Avolition ( OPTION D ) Anhedonia ( OPTION C) Attention

Highyeild:

Positive Symptoms:- Hallucinations : (OPTION B) Auditory hallucinations (voices commenting, voices conversing), Somatic or tactile hallucinations, Olfactory hallucinations, Visual hallucinations. Delusions : Persecutory delusions, Delusions of jealousy, Delusions of guilt or sin, Grandiose delusions, Religious delusions, Somatic delusions, Delusions of reference, Delusions of being controlled, Delusions of mind reading, Thought broadcasting, Thought insertion, Thought withdrawal. Bizarre behavior : Disrobing of Clothing, Aggressive behaviour, Repetitive or stereotyped behaviour. Positive formal thought disorder : Derailment, Tangentiality, Incoherence, Illogicality, Circumstantiality, Pressure of speech, Distractible speech, Clanging. Negative Symptoms:- Affective flattening or blunting : (OPTION A) Unchanging facial expressions, Decreased spontaneous movement, Paucity of expressive gestures, Poor eye contact, Affective non-responsivity, Inappropriate affect, Lack of vocal inflexions. Alogia : Poverty of speech, Poverty of content of speech, Blocking, Increased latency of response. Avolition (OPTION D) Anhedonia (OPTION C) Attention : Social inattentiveness, Inattentiveness during testing.

questions.text: Your psychiatry HOD is taking your class on a rare type of schizophrenia, the catatonic type. Which of the following belong to its classic features of motor function disturbance: Stupor Negativism Rigidity Excitement Posturing Select the correct answer from given below code:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

1, 2, 3, 4, 5 The classic feature of the catatonic type of schizophrenia is a marked disturbance in motor function; this disturbance may involve: Stupor (OPTION 1) Negativism (OPTION 2) Rigidity (OPTION 3) Excitement (OPTION 4) Posturing (OPTION 5)
